sentences.en: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.
sentences.cn: 令人讨厌的小人物身上有着愚蠢的一致性.

sentences.en: Any action on the basis of such fragmentary evidence would be foolish.
sentences.cn: 基于如此不完整的证据采取的任何行动都是愚蠢的。

sentences.en: He turned my question around so that It'sounded foolish.
sentences.cn: 他把我的问题歪曲得听上去愚蠢可笑.

sentences.en: His foolish act has brought a storm about his ears.
sentences.cn: 他的愚蠢行动招致了人们的强烈不满.

sentences.en: His foolish behaviour may put his whole future in jeopardy.
sentences.cn: 他愚蠢的行为可能毁了他一生的前程.

sentences.en: I feel how foolish I am to entertain doubts.
sentences.cn: 我竟然心存怀疑，真是太愚蠢了。

sentences.en: I just stood there feeling foolish and watching him.
sentences.cn: 我只是傻傻地站在那里看着他。

sentences.en: I’ve never heard anything so foolish in all my life.
sentences.cn: 我这辈子从没听到过这么愚蠢的话。

sentences.en: It would be foolish to ignore his advice.
It'surprises me that you, of all people, should be so foolish.
sentences.cn: 所有人中偏偏你这样笨, 真使我惊奇.

sentences.en: Making people feel foolish is emphatically not my strategy.
sentences.cn: 让人出丑显然不是我的策略。

sentences.en: She was alienated from her friend by her foolish behavior.
sentences.cn: 她的愚蠢行为使她的朋友同她疏远了.

sentences.en: That foolish deed of his will remain a blot on his escutcheon.
sentences.cn: 他的那种愚蠢行为将永远是他名誉上的污点.

sentences.en: That foolish fellow is looking for trouble.
sentences.cn: 那个愚蠢的家伙在自找麻烦.

sentences.en: The foolish boy was laughed at wherever he went.
sentences.cn: 这个愚蠢的男孩不论走到哪里都受到讥笑.

sentences.en: We consider them to have been foolish.
sentences.cn: 我们认为他们的做法是愚蠢的.

sentences.en: You ought to be ashamed of your foolish behaviour.
sentences.cn: 你应当为自己的愚蠢行为而感到羞耻.

trans.tran_cn: 愚蠢的，鲁莽的，荒谬的，可笑的，混
trans.tran_en: a foolish action, remark etc is stupid and shows that someone is not thinking sensibly
